channel.title: Steam problem
channel.description: I don't have Source SDK Source SDK Base ans Source SDK Base 2007 in my tools list, how can I get those in my steam account? :[

item.title: Steam problem
item.dc:creator: Stuntz
item.description:
True, because the ONLY Valve game I dont have purchased is Day of Defeat Source, the dedicated shows up of course, but it does NOT show up in my SourceSDK, not ever.

Wow how ironic, maybe im having the same problem as him. I currently am missing Half-Life 2, and Counter-Strike Source in my 2006 Engine, though Half-Life 2 deathmatch DOES show up. It is not in the other engines.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam problem
item.dc:creator: Tinman
item.description:
He stated that he hadn’t purchased any of those games, so he can’t have any of tools. I don’t know what the other exclusions are.

Maybe it’s possible to have access to those tools from having them installed on your PC from another account? I wouldn’t know, I haven’t tried it.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam problem
item.dc:creator: Mith
item.description:
Victus:

I thought tools show up no matter what as not yet installed? 'Cause I remember my list is full of crap but I don’t own it.

The dedicated servers for all the games and steamworks mods show up in your tools tab whether you own the respective games or not. The SDK content only shows up if you own a Source game.

That’s why the list is always full of random stuff, but the SDK isn’t included unless you have a game that unlocks it .

Read full topic

item.title: Steam problem
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
The Source SDK tools are available as long as you have purchased at least one Valve-made Source game. (there are one or two exclusions) I don’t believe you need to have any of them installed at the time for them to show up.

Read full topic
